meanings.definition: A concrete border along the edge of a street.
meanings.sent1: The curb marked the boundary between the road and the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: She tripped on the curb while walking down the street.
meanings.sent3: The curb seemed to challenge the skateboarder to jump over it.
meanings.sent4: The curb stood like a silent guardian at the edge of the pavement.
meanings.sent5: The bright yellow paint on the curb made it easy to spot from afar.

meanings.sent1: Please curb your enthusiasm during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: He tried to curb his anger before speaking.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to curb the students' excitement about the upcoming field trip.
meanings.sent4: She struggled to curb her impulse to buy more shoes.
meanings.sent5: The coach worked hard to curb the team's tendency to argue on the field.

meanings.definition: A check or restraint on something.
meanings.sent1: The new regulations acted as a curb on excessive spending.
meanings.sent2: The curb on sugar intake helped improve his health.
meanings.sent3: The curb on screen time for kids led to more outdoor activities.
meanings.sent4: His fear of failure acted as a curb on his ambition.
meanings.sent5: The strict deadline served as a curb on procrastination.
